SEARCH
Package controller

Class AccountControl

java.lang.Object
controller.AccountControl
public class AccountControl extends Object
The AccountControl class handles all of the logic behind the carious Account GUI operations throughout the system

  • Constructor Summary

    • AccountControl

      public AccountControl() throws SQLException
      Constructs a new AccountControl object, initialising a new CustomerCrud object
      Throws:
      SQLException - Exception thrown if a problem with the query occurs

  • Method Details

    • createAccount

      public void createAccount(String fName, String lName, String email, String adrs, String password, String confirmPass, String phone) throws AccountCreationException, ValidationException
      * Method which handles the account creation process on success (if passwords are equal and not empty as well as all other form fields containing some info, then insert
      Parameters:
      fName - Customers first name
      lName - Customers last name
      email - Customers email
      adrs - Customers address in string format
      password - Customers password
      confirmPass - Confirmation of Customers password
      phone - Customers phone number
      Throws:
      AccountCreationException - For error with account creation
      ValidationException - note how we throw ValidationException, which means we can use our child exception classes PasswordInconsistent and EmptyField, as ValidationException is their super class

    • updateAccount

      public Customer updateAccount(Customer cust, String fName, String lName, String email, String adrs, String password, String confirmPass, String phone) throws AccountCreationException, ValidationException
      * Method which handles the account updating process On success (if passwords are equal and not empty as well as all other form fields containing some info, then update
      Parameters:
      cust - The customer object being edited
      fName - Customers first name
      lName - Customers last name
      email - Customers email
      adrs - Customers address in string format
      password - Customers password
      confirmPass - Confirmation of Customers password
      phone - Customers phone number
      Returns:
      The newly updated Customer object
      Throws:
      AccountCreationException - For error with account creation
      ValidationException - note how we throw ValidationException, which means we can use our child exception classes PasswordInconsistent and EmptyField, as ValidationException is their super class

    • updateAccountExclPass

      public Customer updateAccountExclPass(Customer cust, String fName, String lName, String email, String adrs, String password, String confirmPass, String phone) throws AccountCreationException, ValidationException
      Method which handles the account updating process on success (if passwords are equal and not empty as well as all other form fields containing some info, then update
      Parameters:
      cust - The customer object being edited
      fName - Customers first name
      lName - Customers last name
      email - Customers email
      adrs - Customers address in string format
      password - Customers password
      confirmPass - Confirmation of Customers password
      phone - Customers phone number
      Returns:
      The newly updated Customer object
      Throws:
      AccountCreationException - For error with account creation
      ValidationException - note how we throw ValidationException, which means we can use our child exception classes PasswordInconsistent and EmptyField, as ValidationException is their super class

    • checkFields

      public void checkFields(JTextField fName, JTextField lName, JTextField email, JTextField adrs, JTextField phone, JPasswordField password, JPasswordField confirmPass) throws ValidationException
      Method to handle the validation process for Account Creation
      Parameters:
      fName - The JTextField representing the Customers first name
      lName - The JTextField representing the Customers last name
      email - The JTextField representing the email Customers email
      adrs - The JTextField representing the adrs Customers address in string format
      phone - The JTextField representing the password Customers password
      password - The JPasswordField representing the confirmPass Confirmation of Customers password
      confirmPass - The JPasswordField representing the phone Customers phone number
      Throws:
      ValidationException - note how we throw ValidationException, which means we can use our child exception classes PasswordInconsistent and EmptyField, as ValidationException is their super class

    • checkFieldsEdit

      public void checkFieldsEdit(JTextField fName, JTextField lName, JTextField email, JTextField adrs, JTextField phone) throws ValidationException
      Method to handle the validation process for Account Editing minus the password fields
      Parameters:
      fName - The JTextField representing the Customers first name
      lName - The JTextField representing the Customers last name
      email - The JTextField representing the email Customers email
      adrs - The JTextField representing the adrs Customers address in string format
      phone - The JTextField representing the phone Customers phone number
      Throws:
      ValidationException - note how we throw ValidationException, which means we can use our child exception classes PasswordInconsistent and EmptyField, as ValidationException is their super class

    • checkInfo

      public void checkInfo(JTextField txt, String fieldName) throws EmptyFieldException
      Valid a text field method, encapsulates common code
      Parameters:
      txt - The JTextField object
      fieldName - for displaying the correct field name in the error message
      Throws:
      EmptyFieldException - occurs when an input field that is required is left empty

    • validateForm

      public void validateForm(JTextField phone, JTextField email) throws ValidationException
      Iterates through each text field in the form to check for empty inputs
      Parameters:
      phone - The JTextField representing the Customers phone number
      email - The JTextField representing the Customers email
      Throws:
      ValidationException - occurs when some input field does not meet required validation

    • validatePasswords

      public void validatePasswords(JPasswordField password, JPasswordField confirmPass) throws ValidationException
      Holds logic for password validation checks
      Parameters:
      password - The customers new Password
      confirmPass - The confirmation of their password
      Throws:
      ValidationException - Exception for problem with password validation

    • validateUpdatedPasswords

      public void validateUpdatedPasswords(JPasswordField oldPassEntered, JPasswordField password, JPasswordField confirmPass, Customer cust) throws PasswordInconsistentException, Exception
      Method to perform a validation check on the password section of the update account process
      Parameters:
      oldPassEntered - The Customers old password
      password - The customers new password
      confirmPass - Confirmation of the customers password
      cust - The customer currently logged in
      Throws:
      PasswordInconsistentException - Exception thrown if passwords do not match
      Exception - Generic "super" exception

    • login

      public Customer login(String custEmail, String passWord, Customer customer)
      Method which handles the login process by querying the customers table
      Parameters:
      custEmail - The customers email address
      passWord - The customers password
      customer - The customer created upon successful login
      Returns:
      The logged in customer on success, null on failure
